byline.original: By TIM ARANGO and CEYLAN YEGINSU

abstract: Turkish Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan's Justice and Development Party is expected to fail to recapture majority in Parliament in snap parliamentary election according to most projections, which means country will probably face even more political instability.
lead_paragraph: As Turks warily prepare to vote again in a snap parliamentary election on Sunday, projections hold that, again, no party will win a majority.

headline.main: As Turks Prepare to Vote, Polls Point to Inconclusive Result and More Instability
headline.print_headline: As Turks Prepare to Vote, Polls Point to Inconclusive Result and More Instability

snippet: As Turks warily prepare to vote again in a snap parliamentary election on Sunday, projections hold that, again, no party will win a majority.
